Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two plants: one with enough water and one without water.
The student can show how the plant with water looks healthy and the plant without water looks unhealthy.
The student can illustrate that plants need water by comparing the state of the two plants.
The student can represent the concept that plants need both light and water to live and grow.
The student can identify patterns in their drawing, showing differences between a well-watered plant and a non-watered plant.
